title: Nagorno-Karabakh: Azerbaijan blocks vital route linking enclave to Armenia
description: Baku announced the suspension of traffic on the Lachin corridor on Tuesday, citing 'smuggling' activity on the part of the Armenian branch of the Red Cross.

title: Belarusian artist Ales Pushkin who dumped manure at Alexander Lukashenko's office dies in prison
description: The cartoonist died in a prison in Grodno in western Belarus of unknown causes, even though he wasn't known to be sick, according to the Viasna human rights center. Pushkin was an active participant in protests by the political opposition.

title: Evacuations as Vermont in US hit by catastrophic floods
description: A storm that dumped up to two months of rain in two days in Vermont and other parts of the Northeast brought more flooding Tuesday to communities marooned by water, including the state capital. President Joe Biden declared a state of emergency in the Green Mountain State.

title: Djokovic beats Rublev to earn a place in his 12th Wimbledon semi-final
description: The Serbian tennis giant took four sets to beat Russian Andrey Rublev in front of a packed center court on Tuesday.

title: PSG boss Nasser Al-Khelaifi beset by a mountain of legal proceedings
description: Hicham Karmoussi, a former confidant of the Paris Saint-Germain and BeIN Media boss, filed a further complaint on June 28, notably for 'attempted kidnapping' and 'extortion.'

title: Russian nationalists' grudge intact following Prigozhin's failed mutiny
description: The frustration expressed by the mercenary group's boss over the conduct of the war in Ukraine remains shared by many ultra-Orthodox, neo-Nazi, and imperialist activists.

title: Tour de France 2023: Bilbao overcomes scorching heat to triumph on the hilly 10th stage
description: Dedicating his victory to his team-mate Gino Maeder who died last month after a crash, Pello Bilbao is the first Spaniard to win a stage in the world's biggest cycling race in five years.

title: Trump lawyers ask judge to postpone trial in classified documents case
description: The former president's defense team cited concerns about a fair trial if scheduled before November 2024 election.

title: Ukraine's Svitolina knocks out top seed Swiatek to reach Wimbledon semi-finals
description: Wildcard Elina Svitolina stunned world number one Iga Swiatek to reach the Wimbledon semi-finals. She will face Czech player Marketa Vondrousova, who also caused an upset.

title: Banning the most harmful chemicals could help Europe save up to €31 billion a year
description: A confidential study by the European Commission, which Le Monde was able to read, estimated the health benefits of withdrawing such substances.

title: Israeli government's new push for Supreme Court reform revives protests
description: Opponents have held new rallies to denounce the planned changes to the Supreme Court, after the Knesset began working on the legislation again.

title: War in Ukraine: The United States faces the test of time
description: Despite Washington's reiterated support for Kyiv, questions remain about the extent and duration of its political and military backing.

title: Tour de France 2023: Pogacar's team still struggling against the might of Vingegaard
description: After a week of racing, and despite being strengthened by the arrival of Adam Yates, the UAE Emirates team seems less dominant than the yellow jersey's Jumbo-Visma.

title: Ukraine celebrates the return of Azovstal commanders
description: The five leaders of the Azov Battalion, taken prisoner in May 2022 and then released in an exchange, were supposed to remain in Turkey until the end of the war.

title: NATO chief says no clear timetable for Ukraine's membership, disappointing Zelensky
description: Evidently frustrated, the Ukrainian president launched a furious broadside against Ukraine's NATO after they announced they did not have a defined timetable for Kyiv's membership bid.

title: What is the status of Sweden's NATO bid after Turkey's approval?
description: Recep Tayyip Erdogan gave Sweden's NATO application the green light on Tuesday. So what are the next steps?

title: After the success of its army in Mozambique, Rwanda expects economic rewards
description: Companies affiliated with the powerful Crystal Ventures holding company, the financial arm of Kigali's ruling party, are already present in Mozambique.

title: Post-pandemic fatigue: 'During lockdown, billions of people discovered that their lives could be something else'
description: Despite the official end of the Covid-19 pandemic, a general feeling of exhaustion persists. Historian Georges Vigarello and sociologist David Le Breton trace the evolution of the idea of fatigue.

title: Sunak's government accused of neglecting climate emergency
description: Britain has 'lost its clear global leadership position on climate action,' according to an independent body advising Downing Street.

title: France to send SCALP long-range missiles to Ukraine
description: The announcement was made by French President Macron on the first day of a NATO summit set to be dominated by the alliance's response to Russia's war on Ukraine and Kyiv's push for NATO membership.

title: Lana Del Rey fulfills dream in Paris return
description: The American singer gave an impromptu performance at the Olympia in Paris on Monday, her first concert in France since 2017.

title: Turkey opens NATO door to Sweden after frenetic day of talks
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan agreed on Monday to ratify Sweden's membership of the alliance, but gave no deadline.

title: Tourist helicopter crashes in Nepal, killing six people aboard
description: The tourists were returning to Kathmandu from near Lukla, a gateway for climbing expeditions.

title: War in Ukraine: Russian drones target Odesa region port key to grain deal
description: Ukrainian authorities said most of the 26 drones were downed, with damage restricted to administrative facilities.

title: Jihadism, ultra-right and ultra-left: French intelligence boss calls for 'vigilance'
description: In an interview with Le Monde, Nicolas Lerner, the head of domestic intelligence, describes the country's potential threats.

title: NATO summit: Allies divided over Ukraine's prospects of joining the Atlantic Alliance
description: The 31 members of the Alliance are set to meet in Vilnius, providing an opportunity to clarify the security guarantees they intend to grant Ukraine, even though its entry into the organization is not on the agenda.

title: People of African descent have finally established a strong presence in French cinema
description: The sheer number of filmmakers of African descent and the diversity of genres they are tackling means they are finally experiencing their moment. Their success is both political and aesthetic.

title: Relentless rain floods roads in US Northeast, leads to evacuations, rescues
description: Officials say it is the worst flooding in the state of Vermont since Tropical Storm Irene in 2011. One person has died in the state of New York.

title: 'Mbappé has become a problem for Paris Saint-Germain, and Paris Saint-Germain has become a problem for Mbappé'
description: 'The poker game has resumed between the star football player and his club. So far, it’s been a losing game,' writes Jérôme Latta in his column.
